verses.roman:
dṛṣṭvā pralambaṁ nihataṁ
balena bala-śālinā
gopāḥ su-vismitā āsan
sādhu sādhv iti vādinaḥ

synonyms: dṛṣṭvā—seeing; pralambam—Pralambāsura; nihatam—killed; balena—by Lord Balarāma; bala-śālinā—who is by nature very powerful; gopāḥ—the cowherd boys; su-vismitāḥ—most astonished; āsan—became; sādhu sādhu—"very wonderful, very wonderful"; iti—these words; vādinaḥ—speaking.
translation: The cowherd boys were most astonished to see how the powerful Balarāma had killed the demon Pralamba, and they exclaimed, "Excellent! Excellent!"
